step.context: %text If $A^2-4A-5I$ were to be factored as a quadratic expression would, what would the factors look like? %
step.reason: %text Since A is a matrix, and not a scalar unity or 1 is represented by identity matrix I. % \begin{align} \therefore A^2-4A-5I &= A^2-5A+A-5I \\ &= A(A-5I)+(A-5I) \\ &= \left(A-5I\right)\left(A+I\right) \end{align}

step.context: \left[\begin{array}{rrr} -4 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & -4 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & -4 \end{array}\right]\times \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & 2 \end{array}\right]=? \\ %text If the product of the above matrices is a $3\times 3$ matrix, what is the expression for the middle term $(a_{22})$ of the product? %
step.reason: %text When multiplying two $3\times 3$ matrices M and N, the product matrix P also has $3$ rows and $3$ columns. If $a_{ij}$ is the element in row i and col j of product P, then % a_{ij}=(M_{i1}\times N_{j1})+(M_{i2}\times N_{j2})+ (M_{i3}\times N_{3j}) \\ \text{If }M=\left[\begin{array}{rrr} -4 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & -4 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & -4 \end{array}\right], N=\left[\begin{array}{ccc} 2 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & 2 \\ 2 & 2 & 2 \end{array}\right] \\ \text{then } a_{22}=-(2\times 2)+(-4\times 2)-(2\times 2)=0 \\ %text Multiplying in this way all of the terms in the product matrix would be zero. %
